title: CTRL0000082309 - Transcribed Interview of Marcia Strickler, (May 10, 2022)

data.text: SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE THE
JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES,
WASHINGTON, D.C.
INTERVIEW OF:
MARCIA STRICKLER
Tuesday, May 10, 2022
Washington, D.C.
The interview in the above matter was held via Webex, commencing at 10:09 a.m.
Appearances:
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
STAFF ASSOCIATE
CHIEF CLERK
, INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
SENIOR INVESTIGATIVE COUNSEL
Let's go on the record at 10:09.
Good morning.
Today is May 10th, 2022, and this is the transcribed interview of
Ms. Marcia Strickler conducted by the House Select Committee to Investigate the
January 6th Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to House Resolution 503.
At this time, I'd ask the witness to please state your full name, and then spell your
name for the record also.
Ms. Strickler.
My name is Marcia Strickler, and it's spelled M-a-r-c-i-a
S-t-r-i-c-k-1-e-r.
This will be a staff-led interview, but there may be a time that members choose to
Great.
join the call and ask a few questions themselves.
Ms. Strickler.
Sure.
And there are a couple other staff members, like me, who may join
the call and ask you some questions too.
conversation between you and I.
Ms. Strickler.
name is
But for the most part it'll just be a
Okay.
And I've introduced myself to you before, but for the record my
I'm an investigative counsel with the select committee.
And then we also have on the Webex today
, who is a senior
investigative counsel with the committee.
There are currently no members on the call.
And then I'll also note that, Ms. Strickler, you're here voluntarily for this
transcribed interview and that you don't have counsel present with you today, but you do
have that option.
And then just a couple kind of housekeeping matters before we get started.
As you've heard, there is an official reporter that's going to be transcribing our
conversation.
before you start your answer.
talking over each other.
Ms. Strickler.
And so, with that in mind, if you can just wait until I finish my questions
It makes their job a little bit easier so that we're not both
Got it.
And then, kind of in the same vein, just make sure that you're using
verbal responses as opposed to like a head shake or something like that.
transcribe the things that we actually say.
Does that make sense?
Ms. Strickler.
He can only
Yes.
Okay.
And then today I'm just asking that you provide complete
answers based on your best recollection.
asking you about happened a year or more ago.
you're not sure about an answer, feel free to let me know or just say I don't recall or I
don't know the answer to that question.
Ms. Strickler.
I understand a lot of the events that I'll be
And so, if you're ballparking a figure or
Okay.
And then this is a warning or kind of a caution that we provide every
witness that we talk to, and that's just that I need to let you know that it is unlawful to
provide false information to a congressional investigator like myself.
interview, providing false information could result in criminal penalties under a law called
the False Statements Act.
And so, for this
And I just want to make sure that you're aware of that.
And sort of like I said earlier, if you're just ballparking a figure, that's not going to
be an issue.
Just let me know if you're unsure about an answer.
Ms. Strickler.
All right.
Ms. Strickler.
It's just concerns over deliberately false statements.
Got it.
And then, at any point today, just let me know if you need to take a
break for water, anything like that.
I'll try to take a break in about an hour, and
hopefully we won't go much longer than about an hour and a half or two hours, so we'll
get a break in there.
Ms. Strickler.
Just let me know if you need a break at any other time.
Okay.
Great.
EXAMINATION
BY-:
Then we can start with just a little bit of background information about you.
Q
Can you tell me where you currently live?
A
In Austin, Texas.
Q
Okay.
And if you could just give me a little bit of your kind of educational
and professional background.
A
Okay.
I moved here in 1981 to Austin from Houston.
I went to school.
worked, worked my way through school, and also spent the last probably 18 years of my
career working at Dell Computer.
Q
Great.
And other than working at Dell Computer, any other kind of
professional activity or anything that you're engaged in now professionally?
I retired about 10 years ago, but I still am
involved politically.
A
political activist.
elections, both paid and unpaid, volunteer as poll worker and poll watcher.
I work a lot at the capitol with our legislation.
I'm a
I've worked with
I also work on campaigns throughout Texas on various Texas State-level and
municipal-level campaigns.
And I'm co-director of a group called True Texas Project.
Q
Okay.
And can you tell me, have you ever worked on a Federal campaign,
like for the U.S. House or Senate?
A
I have worked on the Presidential campaigns, and I have worked on a couple
of congressional campaigns, U.S. congressional.
Q
Okay.
A
Louie Gohmert, Ted Cruz, and Donald Trump.
Q
Okay.
It's
an organization that has monthly meetings in our county.
It's all volunteer.
And which congressional campaigns have you worked on, if you
recall?
And have you ever worked on a campaign for
Representative Ronny Jackson?
A
I have not.
Q
And then, other than -- did you say it's the True Texas Project?
A
Uh-huh.
Q
Is that what it's called?
A
True Texas Project.
Q
Other than that organization, are there any other political organizations like
that that you're associated with?
A
There are quite a few local Williamson County, the county I live in,
Republican groups that I attend.
Leander Area Republican Women is one of them I go to
on a regular basis.
member, but I go to the meetings quite often.
There is another one called Moms for Liberty that I go to.
I'm not a
Q
Okay.
A
And depending on speakers at various meetings throughout our county, if
it's a good speaker, I'll go, but you won't find me on the member roster.
Q
Okay.
Let's talk a little bit about the Oath Keepers and your involvement
with them.
Can you tell me when you first met or -- well, first I'll ask, have you met
Mr. Rhodes, Mr. Stewart Rhodes?
A
I have.
Q
Okay.
A
I don't know the exact date, and I don't know the exact timing, but it was
And can you tell me when you first met him?
probably at least 5 years ago.
Q
And how did you meet him?
A
I knew of him prior to 5 years ago, just because he has been in the news and
been very active in various hurricanes, tornados, things like that in the area.
But I
actually met him, I believe, at the capitol in Texas at a rally, is where I believe I first
actually met him face to face.
Q
So you were familiar with him through some of your disaster relief work?
A
The disaster relief work is primarily how I got to know him, because we have
a lot of hurricanes in this territory, and that was one of many groups that I was involved
with that got involved and showed up to help, kind of like Red Cross.
And when you say that group, you mean Mr. Rhodes' group, the Oath
Q
Keepers?
A
Correct.
Q
Were there any particular, other than Mr. Rhodes, any other Oath Keepers
The local chapter.
The Texas chapter.
that you were particularly familiar with and that you knew well?
A
None that I know well.
I mean, I know some of their names from being on
some of their Signal chats, but not anybody that I've ever spent any particular time with.
Q
As far as other Oath Keepers that you've met in person, is that a big
number?
A
Can we talk about who those folks might be?
Well, the various things that they get involved with, like at the capitol, for
example, there might be five -- five men, maybe even a woman, but usually about five or
six men, something like that.
my children's names, but I'm not great at names.
Q
I could not tell you their names.
So then other than Mr. Rhodes, would you say you don't know any other
Oath Keepers by name, or are there others that you can think of?
A
I do know a fellow named John Siemens.
Q
Did Mr. Rhodes live with John at some point?
A
I do believe he did.
And I do know Chad Rogers.
Q
I mean, I'm not -- I know
I believe he's in San Antonio area.
Never met him in person, but I know him by phone.
And then this event that you met Mr. Rhodes at, at the State capitol, do you
recall what sort of event that was?
A
It probably had something to do with one of the top legislative priorities,
which is why I'm at the capitol all the time, fighting for those top legislative priorities.
So this past year it was probably -- I don't remember the exact rally title or what
we were fighting for at that point, but the heartbeat bill would have been one.
carry, or constitutional carry is what we called it, would have been another.
Open
Various rallies tied to legislative, either the house or the senate, whoever
authored the bill that was fighting for that priority would have, like, a rally at the front of
the capitol, and we'd go.
So I don't recall the actual name of the rally where I met him, but I met him in
person the same time I met Kellye SoRelle.
Q
They were both at that rally together?
A
They were.
So from that point, after you met Mr. Rhodes and Ms. SoRelle, can you just
Q
take me through kind of how your relationship evolved and how you became involved in
the Oath Keepers?
A
Well, probably -- in 2020 we had some problems with the election here in
our county, and I was working the elections at that time as a tech support in the field.
And there were about five or six, a handful of municipal races, as well as a countywide
race, that planned to file a contest, is what they call them, an election contest.
And I got involved in that because I was asked to do an affidavit for that
lawsuit -- for those lawsuits -- and ended up getting very involved.
Kellye SoRelle came in.
She was the attorney on record.
And so I got to know her really well.
Rhodes.
Q
And that's where
And, at the time, she was dating Stewart
So got to know them both because of that lawsuit.
Between the period 5 years ago that you had met them, and then 2020 for
the election, what was your contact with or involvement with either Mr. Rhodes or
Ms. SoRelle?
A
A lot on the phone with Kellye So Re lie because of that lawsuit and --
Q
Sorry.
A
Before --
Q
-- and before 2020.
A
Very little.
Just to be clear, I'm talking about before those lawsuits started --
Nothing with Kellye SoRelle.
If Stewart Rhodes came into
town and there was --you know, he may have let me know about it, and then I would
have maybe some supper with him or something.
dates or specifics.
I mean, it was -- I can't remember
At one point, we interviewed him on a neighborhood watch project that we were
doing, so he came in and did that, and we interviewed for that.
I don't remember if that
was before or after.
I think it was before the election.
He was on a lot of various news groups around here being interviewed, so I would
see him when he was in an interview, and then sometimes we would meet up for supper
while he was in town or something like that.
Q
And am I correct that you -- you're not a registered Oath Keeper yourself?
A
I am not a registered Oath Keeper.
I'm not really qualified to -- they have a
qualification of being a veteran or a medic or something like that, I think, and I don't have
any of those skills.
Q
Did you at some point want to join and you were told you couldn't, or that
was just kind of your assessment, that you didn't fit the profile?
A
No, I didn't really ever want to join.
I did communicate with Stewart and
Kellye a lot through Signal, and then I would give my opinion to Stewart about various
people on his chat groups when I would see something that looked to me like off, like
maybe someone was, I don't know, verbally saying something that might be construed
the wrong way or whatever.
And so I would make a comment to Stewart saying, You might want to watch A, B,
C, D, whoever it was.
someone that you might want to be careful of.
Seems like a hothead or somebody that has a temper problem or
Because he never really wanted to have anybody on his chat groups, especially his
leadership group, that would be perceived that way, I guess is the best way to say it.
Q
So in addition to -- I know you kind of mentioned hotheads -- was there
anything in particular you were monitoring for or that he asked you to look out for?
A
No.
I kind of just did it on my own.
And I didn't do it regularly.
I'm not
one that would just sit there on their Signal chat and look.
But every once in a while
there might be something in the news, so I would go out to their Signal chat and just see
what they were doing and what was going on.
I was a trusted friend, I believe, is why I got added to the chats.
feedback.
valuing my opinion.
Q
And I gave
And a lot of times the feedback, I guess, would come true, so he started
Is there -- can you think of any kind of particular instances where you had
some sort of information like that, feedback or an opinion about somebody, and they
became true?
A
I do remember that there was somebody, I don't recall the name, I believe it
was in one of the Carolinas, either South Carolina or North Carolina, somewhere over on
the East Coast, that was always just kind of making comments kind of just to cause
disruption, you know?
specifics about it, but I think he ended up getting kicked out of at least the chat.
know about the group.
Kind of just a bully or whatever.
And don't remember the
I don't
Not from what I had said, but other people were seeing it, too.
And that Stewart Rhodes was not always on the chat group either monitoring it.
And if you know what chat's like, it's similar to anything else, Telegram or even your
phone chat.
missed or whatever.
You've got to kind of go backwards 2 or 3 days to see what you might have
So there was a lot of times that he wouldn't understand what the problem was
unless he did that, because -- so I just don't notice that -- maybe four or five times, you
know, a handful of times.
Q
And do you recall specific chats that you were on?
Were there primary
chats that you would monitor?
A
There was a nation chat, a national chat.
There was a Texas chat.
And
then, when they would do group ops, different ops, like there was a -- when they went to
Kentucky, I think there was a Kentucky chat.
I had friends in Kentucky, so I guess they added me because I had told them about
some friends that I had there that may be aware of the territory.
there.
They had just moved
But then when that operation or whatever you call it would be done, that chat
would go away usually, or I would delete it, one or the other.
how -- if there was any others.
I think that was pretty much it.
that.
put on it.
Q
Well, and then the D.C. op chat.
I was put on
I'm very familiar with D.C., I've been there a few times, and probably why I was
And let's talk about also kind of what on these chats you still might have or
to what extent you maintained any of the chats.
your Signal or where they are now?
Can you tell me what happened with
So my Signal was -- I created the Signal using a Google phone call -- phone
A
It was just -- let me think
number -- that I had gotten, and -- instead of my -- just the number you have for me, my
cell number.
Someone had told me to do that.
I don't know why.
But what I learned is in Google world, if you don't use that phone number, like
literally talk on it, after 3 months they give it to someone else.
that.
And I thought using it on Signal meant I was using it, but apparently that's not
using it.
You have to actually talk on it within every 3 months.
So not too, too long ago I found out that that number had been given to someone
else.
They had both numbers, I guess, and someone else answered.
So when I found that out, I just deleted the whole thing.
And so I didn't know
Someone actually tried calling me on that number instead of my cell number.
But I have since turned
chat back on -- I mean, Signal back on with my cell -- my personal cell number, because I
use it for other things, not -- it wasn't just Oath Keepers.
that I was doing, other communication.
I was using it for other things
So that D.C. thing, I don't remember when I got off of it.
Probably after all that
mess started happening and it just got weird, so I just got off.
But let's see.
Not too, too long ago there was a J6 support chat group.
they were raising money for some of the men that were in jail.
Have you called -- sorry.
And --
I'll just stop you there for a second.
Q
Have you tried to log back into Signal with your old Google voice number?
I think
Do
you know if you could call back up that account?
A
I haven't, because I found out that someone else is using that number.
called and talked to those people that are using that number, and they had had it for, I
guess, a month or so.
on, like, business cards and stuff.
They're out of Fort Worth, and they had already put that number
I was going to fight it and say, Well, that's my number.
But it wasn't that big of a
deal to me, so I just got rid of it and turned Signal back on with my cell phone.
Q
All right.
We might potentially, after this interview, ask you to see if you
could log into your old Signal account and see if you still have access to any of those
messages.
A
Okay.
Q
And then when -- was it around the same time that the election challenge
But for now that'll be fine.
was going to be filed in Texas where you became involved with Mr. Rhodes and
Ms. So Re lie, is that about the same time you started joining some of the Oath Keeper
Signal chats?
A
Yes, it is, about that same -- well, I may have been on one of the chats.
think I was on one of the chats earlier than 2020 election, because -- maybe remind me.
Do you remember when the Kentucky thing happened, all that stuff in Kentucky, when
that was?
Q
Was that before the election?
It seems like it was.
The Louisville, right, that I know that the Oath Keepers were present in, I
believe around September, so there was some time before.
A
We had some issues here in Austin with some antifa and Black Lives Matter rallies
and things that the Oath Keepers came and helped with, and I probably would have been
on those as well, on whatever that chat was, I don't remember the title of it, because I
was actually very active in going to the capitol and fighting for these legislative priorities,
and we needed some kind of security backup.
So that's kind of how I got to know them.
Q
So I was on that group chat, so that would have been before.
I wasn't usually the one that would ask for the security, but they would be there.
Yeah.
As far as your activity on the Oath Keeper Signal chats, did anybody ever
refer to you or tell you that you were providing intel, or were you like an intel group?
A
No, but I guess I was there on that day providing some kind of an intel.
mean, I guess that's what I did, if you wanted to give it a title.
I wasn't -- no.
I wasn't asked to do that.
I mean, I guess to answer your question, no one ever told me that.
The information I shared with them was information that was out on Google or
out there in the internet somewhere, so -- but not everyone has time to see what I was
seeing, so I just posted it out there on that chat.
Q
Sure.
That's helpful.
I'm just sort of trying to understand what folks
understood your role on the chats to be --
A
I don't even know that folks knew who I was other than Stewart and maybe
John.
Maybe Chad.
I mean, I wasn't that active on the Signals.
I would watch more
than I would participate unless I saw something, and then I might put in a word, or I
would go to a Signal with Stewart specifically and tell him.
Q
Great.
Now, I think we can start looking at -- I pulled a few excerpts of
some of the Signal chats that we've been talking about.
A
Okay.
Q
Specifically the D.C. Signal chats from January 6th.
And those chats started
earlier, so we'll look at a few that are from a couple days before the 6th and some that
are right after the 6th.
A
Okay.
Q
And we've got one of our professional staff members on the call who is going
to help me with some of the exhibits.
And I want to know if you're able to read that or if you want us to zoom in a little
So if we could pull up exhibit 1.
bit.
Are you able to read that?
A
I think I can.
Q
Sure.
A
The transcriber something goes kind of right across it in my view, but --
Q
I can read out loud for you the part that I'm going to ask you about.
A
Okay.
Q
And then, if you need -- just let me know if you want to actually look at the
If you'll give me just a minute.
document or there is something that you can't see that I'm talking about.
A
Okay.
Q
So this is exhibit 1.
A
Okay.
Q
And there is a message that you sent, and it looks like it's in response to
This is just one page from the DC OP: Jan 6 21 Signal
chat.
Stewart Rhodes, because you start the message with the initial SR.
It says, "SR -- is there someone there live-streaming that stage?
If so can you get
a link so we can add to monitor?"
And you can also see at the top of the message that this is from January 6th and
sent at 11:35 a.m.
A
Got it.
Q
So a couple of questions just about that message first.
You said, "Is there a link so we can add to monitor?"
I was just kind of wondering who is the "we" that you're talking about there, or do
you recall who "we" was?
A
going on at that stage, I think is what that was.
So Kellye So Re lie was scheduled to be on one of the stages that day, and I wanted
to watch what it was that she was going to say.
One of the things that they were doing there were protection for VIPs, and Kellye
Anybody that's on this chat that wanted to take a look and see what was
was one of those VIPs basically that day.
And she and I had spoken before, and she was real concerned about her speech
and what she was going to be talking about and just kind of nervous about being in front
of that big of a crowd, so I wanted to monitor what she was doing.
Q
So just to clarify, the "we" is just kind of the royal "we", everybody on the
A
Yeah.
Q
Not a specific group of people that were monitoring?
A
Not that I can recall.
Q
All right.
And then, leading into the 6th, I just kind of want to ask you generally, what did
chat?
I don't recall a specific "we".
And we can take this exhibit down,-·
Thank you.
you understand was going to be happening on the 6th?
specifically, what were the Oath Keepers going to be doing on the 6th as far as you were
aware?
A
And then a little more
Well, President Trump had called for people to come.
there the previous month.
participate.
I wasn't going to go.
And I had just been
But I wanted to watch.
I wanted to
It was all over the news.
And my understanding of the Oath Keepers is that they had been asked to provide
protection service for three -- well, four people, including Kellye -- for Kellye, for General
Flynn, for Ali Alexander, and for -- I always forget the other guy's name -- Roger Stone.
I believe all of those people were going to be speaking on one of those stages,
which is -- I wanted to watch that, too.
weren't those stages.
A lot of what was being shown on local news
It was just talking heads mostly.
So I finally did find a place -- a link.
Someone sent me a link that had cameras at
every one of the stages and all of the various activities going on in D.C. that I watched
from home.
Q
You named the four individuals that you knew Oath Keepers were going to
be providing some security for.
Did you ever hear discussions about Oath Keepers providing security for any
elected officials?
A
I did not.
Q
Okay.
Do you know any of the Florida Oath Keepers, particularly
Kelly Meggs?
A
Only by name since, in the news.
I've never talked with Kelly Meggs.
Only just by probably the same way you know.
Q
So, at some point, there are some messages exchanged where Mr. Meggs
represents that he's been told that the Oath Keepers were going to provide security for
eight Members of Congress.
discussion of that?
A
None.
None whatsoever.

Okay.
And then I think you also mentioned that you were in D.C. the
month before.
A
like that.
White House at that time to see the Christmas decorations.
Does that ring any bells for you, or you don't recall any
Was that for the December 12th event?
I don't remember the actual date of when I went.
It was to visit my son and see him for Christmas.
What happened December 12th?

It wasn't for an event
And he got me a tour to the
I'm not even sure what that was.
The December 12th, if you're aware, there were two large MAGA rallies, one

was the major Stop the Steal protests that happened in November and December in D.C.

But it
Although I was involved with Stop the Steal rallies here in Austin, that was

Some people call them MAGA I, MAGA II.
Okay.
And, no, I didn't attend.
A couple other questions about the chats.
We'll just kind of go

But one question I have for you.
believe, is a woman named Liberty Fairfield.

It does not.
I mean, it doesn't mean I haven't seen it before, but a lot of

Horsewhisperer.
I don't recollect seeing it.
Okay.
So I don't know who that is.
And I may have seen the name before.
But I couldn't tell you who it was.
Great.
That's fine.

I want to ask a little bit about your involvement in the Oath Keepers' preparation

And to help us have that discussion, if we could pull up exhibit 3.

one's a message from January 4th, 2021.

do recall putting it out there saying:
com ms go down, because you won't be able to talk to anybody.
into why I was sending some pictures that day, thinking that maybe their com ms had

questions.

pre-planned.

Had you ever had any conversations with Oath Keepers before about using

A
I have not, no.
I probably -- I don't recall for sure -- found this someplace
